content.question: The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of the continuous function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 8 comma 4, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> has horizontal tangent lines at <math alttext="x equals, negative 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="x equals, negative 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> both decreasing and concave up?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 8 comma negative 6, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 6 comma negative 5, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>,</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma 0, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 6 comma negative 5, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>,</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
